title: [Feat]: Ability to join/transfer an ongoing call from another device
body:
### Describe the feature

Allow joining or transferring an active Teams call from another device to the teams-for-linux client.

### Motivation

Hi Ismael (and contributors),
First of all, thank you for your great work on teams-for-linux. It's an invaluable tool for Linux users!
I would like to request a new feature that mirrors functionality available in the official Microsoft Teams clients (Windows, macOS, mobile).

Currently, if a user is already in a Teams call or meeting on one device (e.g., a Windows PC or a smartphone), the official Teams client on another device, upon launch, detects the ongoing call and offers options like:
"Add this device": Join the ongoing call with the second device, adding it to the session (often muting the mic/speaker initially).
"Transfer to this device": Move the entire call session from the first device to the second one, ending the call on the original device.

Current Behaviour in teams-for-linux:
As far as I can tell, teams-for-linux does not currently detect if the user is already in a call on another device signed into the same account. Therefore, there is no option to join or transfer an existing active call to the Linux client.

Desired Behaviour:
It would be extremely helpful if teams-for-linux could detect an ongoing call associated with the user's account on other devices and provide similar options ("Join" / "Transfer") to seamlessly bring the Linux client into the active session.

Use Case / Motivation:
This feature significantly enhances flexibility. Users often need to switch devices during a call (e.g., move from a mobile device to a desktop for better screen sharing or a more stable connection) or might want to use their Linux machine alongside another device (e.g., manage video/screenshare on Linux while handling audio on a phone).

Thank you for considering this feature request!
